website_summaries.verdict: What happens in Vegas can come home with you, with this set featuring several prominent landmarks along the Las Vegas strip.
pros: Features replicas of the sky-scraping Stratosphere tower, Bellagio, Luxor, and Encore hotels as well as downtown Fremont Street
With 487 pieces, it's designed for builders age 12 and up
cons: Could include a higher level of detail

customer_reviews.title: All fans of Vegas should have this
customer_reviews.text: I am not a Lego person, but I am a Vegas person and when I saw this set I just had to have it! Having not touched a Lego brick for eons - and having never built anything with a guide book, the assembly was a bit confusing at first. The biggest problem I had was identifying the part colors (light grey vs dark gray, clear brick vs smoke brick). But, a couple of hours later, I had a mini-Las Vegas skyline just like the picture on the box. Would love to see an expansion kit to add more buildings.
customer_reviews.author: G. Maus

customer_reviews.title: XiaoWei
customer_reviews.text: The city buildings are very beautiful, but they look a little smaller after they are finished.
customer_reviews.author: Xiaowei

customer_reviews.title: Another Quality set from the Architecture Series
customer_reviews.text: If you are a lego fan and an architecture fan then you probably have a few sets from their Architecture series. I have all the skyline sets and most of the others and so when Lego release this set I just had to purchase it. It is another well done set and even with the delay and redesign after the Vegas shooting incident it still looks beautiful. There were a lot of places they could have picked from the strip to include and personally I think Caesar's should have had some space here they really did make it look wonderful.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Very Cool
customer_reviews.text: My nephew is a huge fan of Legos, and has a few of the Lego Architecture sets. He did not have Vegas yet, so I was excited to get this for him, and to share with him what each area of the strip were represented. While you can't capture all of Vegas in a set like this, they do a great job of getting some of the standouts. The Bellagio fountains and Luxor are represented. They also include the Vegas sign, as well as the Stratosphere. I shocked my nephew when I told him I had been to all of these locations, and had even jumped off the Stratosphore myself. Very cool to see that represented in this model.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby D

customer_reviews.title: Great detail!
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Such great detail! Ends up fairly small once built, but it’s very nice to display. The finished product ends up approximately 12 inches long by 2.5 inches deep by 8 inches high just due to the top of the cool Stratosphere! Yes, I measured it as that’s something I would like to know. :) There are details like clear bricks for water, bushes, and even the Bellagio fountains! There’s even a tiny Las Vegas sign! My son, who is 17, and quite the expert at Legos, still enjoyed building it and completed it in about 1.5 hours. So happy with it! I wish the other architecture Lego sets were as affordable as this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Vegas baby, Vegas
customer_reviews.text: In middle the Las Vegas is not one of the places that I personally think of in terms of great architecture, but that doesn’t distract from the fact is this is a great piece of Lego architecture series, and definitely worth having if you’re a collector or just the fan, or just looking for an afternoon project. It’s a great display in the series is just out-of-control brilliant. I really have to commend Lego for doing such a fantastic job with the architecture series. If you’re a fan of architecture And A Lego builder do you’ve got to be the cornerstone of any collection you put together. It’s no Robie house, but it’s pretty cool
customer_reviews.author: Edward O

customer_reviews.title: My 8yr old son loved it
customer_reviews.text: My 8yr old boy loves to put together lego's. He is very high energy so getting him lego's is not only great for him to just sit and focus on something for a while but great for his parents sanity as well. He thoroughly enjoys building lego's...has built countless of all types and sizes...and never wants our help lol. He really enjoyed putting this one together and insisted I bring it to work and put it on my desk which of course I did so proudly. Great looking skyline of Vegas although I've never been
customer_reviews.author: Vermonter

customer_reviews.title: Trip to Las Vegas
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in response to spending a week in Las Vegas (they didn't actually sell these there, so I bought one on Amazon). I haven't done anything with Lego's since I was a little kid (so many, many, many years ago). It was pretty much as I expected putting it together, though there were a lot of extra little random pieces lying around (extra's maybe?) Better to have more than not have all the pieces. The buildings are not the order they are on the strip, as other have pointed out, but that's something that doesn't bother me.
customer_reviews.author: shadowgate100

customer_reviews.title: Fun!
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my 33 year old son - always loved Legos all his life. This set I bought because he and his wife were married in Vegas and I thought this would be fun. It was fun and challenging - and it looks amazing. It now sits on the shelf next to their Vegas mementos and wedding photo! I am a huge fan of England - so I think his next project will be building the London skyline for me!!
customer_reviews.author: Linda C

customer_reviews.title: Great Set!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this! It was very easy to assemble and would be a great gift for people who frequent Las Vegas or anyone who has been there or just enjoys it. The instruction book that it comes with is also very cool because with each piece of the Las Vegas "strip" that you're building, it gives you a real picture of it, and a little bit of background on the structure.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren MacShara

customer_reviews.title: Great set.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great addition to the Lego skyline series. My 10yr old son enjoys building and displaying them. I like the realism in the design for their small scale. Highly recommend the LEGO Architecture series to anyone that enjoys building buildings. I like the fact that don't take up a lot of room to display with other kits.
customer_reviews.author: Leah

customer_reviews.title: Nice skyline of Vegas that’s a joy to assemble.
customer_reviews.text: LEGO makes a great product and this is no exception. The instructions are really clear. The detail is really nice. It was a treat to put together. Shipping was fast and product arrived as specified.
customer_reviews.author: K Hegler

customer_reviews.title: We loved putting this together!
customer_reviews.text: We're a military family and always like to get a memento from the area we are stationed...this Lego kit was perfect!! It was fun to assemble with my husband, I would say as long as you aren't trying to let really little kids help, it should be easy. There are a LOT of very small pieces, as with probably most of the Lego Architecture kits. But, I just set out a few ramekins and it was done in no time. Very fun and the finished product is truly awesome. A wonderful memento of our time in Vegas!
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: A Good challenge
customer_reviews.text: Finally, a challenge for our son. Regular size LEGO sets get completed in no time. This took some time to assemble and our son was hooked on this project. It was completed before dinner, but it made him think.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: ANOTHER PIECE OF THE CITY
customer_reviews.text: I gave this Lego set to my two 9-yr old great nephews for Christmas. They have built a whole city of Lego buildings, cars, planes, ships and wanted to expand their "City" to include a section of Las Vegas. They love building the Lego sets and work together building each Lego "challenge". The more pieces, the more they look forward to putting it together.
customer_reviews.author: Cee M Well

customer_reviews.title: So Cool!
customer_reviews.text: LEGO is always so fun and amazing! I can never say enough positive Things about LEGO. The LEGO architecture sets are my favorite. A LOT of little pieces, a steady hand and patients is required.
customer_reviews.author: Scott M

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Replica
customer_reviews.text: This is a beautiful replica of some of the landmarks on the Strip. I bought this for my husband as a Christmas gift and he thoroughly enjoyed building it!
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra Lonardoni

customer_reviews.title: Attractive even if you don't love legos
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband for his birthday and he loved it. He loves legos. It wasn't too easy (because that's boring) but he put it together while watching tv so it took a couple of hours. It looks really nice.
customer_reviews.author: Mamabear

customer_reviews.title: Some of the pieces are small so it exercises the nimbleness of your fingers
customer_reviews.text: This is super fun for all ages it really teaches following directions closely and it's a Keepsake when it's done I bought two of them I put one together and I gave one to my granddaughter who enjoyed putting it together!
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Great LEGO set
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my 8 year old grandson! He loves building the Architecture ones lately! They are smaller in size than I thought! I never read the dimensions, but that wasn’t a problem! They have them listed for ages 12 and up but it really matters on the child! This set was great! He had it together in a short time!
customer_reviews.author: Judy

customer_reviews.title: Fun build
customer_reviews.text: I very much enjoy the skyline pieces, they are very fun to build and look good on display afterwards. Great for older children or adults; especially anyone who particularly likes Vegas itself.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Viva Las Vegas!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a huge fan of the Architecture series. When they came out with the Vegas one, I was really excited. I've been there a number of times and have explored all of these buildings. Having a likeness of some of the more iconic hotels makes me smile about stuff that's staying in Vegas every time I look at it!
customer_reviews.author: MRN Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for a ‘grown up’ LEGO fan
customer_reviews.text: I have this to my adult brother who continues to find joy in the ‘grown up’ LEGO sets. He said this was a great build!
customer_reviews.author: Jenna M. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Vegas Strip
customer_reviews.text: I really like it, it looks just like a miniature Vegas strip and resembles the hotels closely. I saw the review where they replaced the Mandalay Bay hotel with the Bellagio Hotel and both look nice. I tried to image if they moved the Bellagio down but I think it would be too tall in the middle if they reversed it with the Luxor hotel, that's probably why they kept them out of order. I do think the MGM Grand would have also been a suitable replacement but Bellagio is good as well.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin H

customer_reviews.title: Good for collections :)
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my 13 year old cousin. He likes to collect them, he didn't have any issue building it and he says it looks cool :)

product_meta.title: LEGO Architecture Skyline Collection Las Vegas Building Kit 21047 (501 Pieces)
product_meta.description: Recreate the architectural magnificence of Las Vegas, Nevada, with this realistic 21047 LEGO Architecture Skyline Collection model. This LEGO brick collectible features iconic attractions located on and around the Las Vegas strip, including the Bellagio hotel, Luxor hotel, Encore hotel, stratosphere tower and the downtown Fremont street experience, and is finished with a decorative “Las Vegas” nameplate. LEGO Architecture Skyline Collection models are suitable for display in the home and office, and have been developed for all with an interest in travel, architectural culture, history and design. Each souvenir toy is scaled to give an accurate representation of the comparative size of each structure, with realistic color depiction.
feature_bullets: Build a LEGO interpretation of the Las Vegas skyline featuring iconic Las Vegas attractions!
This Las Vegas, Nevada LEGO skyline model includes the Bellagio Hotel, Luxor Hotel, Encore Hotel, Stratosphere Tower and the downtown Fremont Street Experience
Measures over 7-inch (19cm) high, 10-inch (27cm) wide and 2-inch (7cm) deep
LEGO Architecture building toys are compatible with all LEGO construction sets for creative building
501 pieces – Las Vegas souvenir model for boys and girls over 12 years old

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars1,111 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
